content.description: Start this one from a swim or paddle board and look out for crumbly sandstone. Jam the crack all the way up and get ready for a running jump back into the drink. Remember to take a picture from the top before, or even better, AS you jump. Nephanie NEVER misses an opportunity to take a good picture!
content.protection: DWS with a push off - Toprope would be better and there are plenty of good anchor points up top.
content.location: At the NW corner of Gunsight Bay, you'll find two distinct fingers. Take the one on the right and go just across the water from Kiggy-Dee and Dub-J before you make the corner to Liggity-Lu. All four are marked on the map image. Water levels were higher at FA than the map image shows, making for a nice kayak/swim start.

content.description: Liggity-Lu is a fun route from a kayak or swim start. Once you're past the first ledge, it's all just a quick climb up to a great dive (if the water is high enough) back into the clear water. Most of the climb is below the high water mark, so the sandstone can be crumbly. Please do a handstand at the top before you jump - Liggity-Lu does handstands EVERYWHERE!!!
content.location: At the NW corner of Gunsight Bay, you'll find two distinct fingers. Take the one on the right and and go just around the corner from Kiggy-Dee and Dub-J across the water from Nephanie. All four are marked on the map image. Water levels were higher at FA than the map image shows, making for a nice kayak/swim start.

content.description: This is a fun quick climb with a huge crack to jam. Skip the easiest foot holds and opt for the slopers, or this becomes a much easier route! Coming out of the water past the crumbly stuff is the toughest bit and when you get to the top you can use your best monster voice to say "Do it for the cliff dive Sammy" just like Kiggy-Dee would do!
content.location: At the NW corner of Gunsight Bay, you'll find two distinct fingers. Take the one on the right and Kiggy-Dee is right next to Dub-J and just across the water from Nephanie before you go around the corner to Liggity-Lu. All four are marked on the map image. Water levels were higher at FA than the map image shows, making for a nice kayak/swim start.

content.description: Dub-J follows a nice little crack in the crumbly sandstone out of the water. Go for the swim start if you can! Once you reach the first ledge, stay to the smaller crack on the right to keep it a bit more difficult! Find a rock on top and throw it as far as you can across the canyon. Odds are Dub-J can throw it further and harder; that's just the way it is...
content.location: At the NW corner of Gunsight Bay, you'll find two distinct fingers. Take the one on the right and and start just 10 feet shy of Kiggy-Dee and just across the water from Nephanie. All three are marked on the map image. Water levels were higher at FA than the map image shows, making for a nice kayak/swim start.
